New Records: England conceded a record number of runs and suffered their biggest losing margin in the World Cup
Key Match Events: Reece Topley's injury shifted the momentum of the match in favor of South Africa
Heinrich Klaasen's 67-ball 109 and Marco Jansen's 75 off 42 heaved the game beyond England's reach
A freewheeling 33-ball, 73-run ninth-wicket partnership between Mark Wood and Gus Atkinson made England's earlier struggles seem even more embarrassing
Pre-Game Insights: England promised they could yet scale new heights despite losing two of their first three World Cup games
Post-Match Reflections: England's hopes hang by thread after third defeat in four
The picture is already clear: their old-timers thought this could be one last hurrah, but it has been a bridge too far
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa's batting display exposed all the frailties of their opponents, physical, mental and technical
The hot and humid conditions transformed the game into a brutal endurance event
Heinrich Klaasen's century was remarkable despite his obvious discomfort
Others: England tried to refresh their side, making three changes to the team that lost to Afghanistan last Sunday, but it exposed a dearth of talent
